choices.A: Denied users are blocked for 30 minutes.
choices.C: The number of logs generated by denied traffic is reduced.
choices.D: Device detection on all interfaces is enforced for 30 minutes.
choices.B: A session for denied traffic is created.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
The timer is set in seconds, not minutes.

global) # set block-session-timer 
block-session-timer Enter an integer value from <1> to <300> (default = <30>).

Selected Answer: BC
Correct Answers are B, C

Selected Answer: BC
Set ses-denied-traffic create a session
if you don't specify a timer, you will get a complete log for denied traffic session, that could be bad for resources,
in this case, that log is being limited to 30 minutes only so you get a limited log

comments.content: set block session timer 30 causes denied traffic sessions to remain in the sessions table for 30 "seconds" not minutes

discussion.content: why is it not A? I thought A and B

Selected Answer: BC
B and C

Selected Answer: BC
FGT 7.4 ASG
B&C ans
B and C correct

questions.question_text: Which method allows management access to the FortiGate CLI without network connectivity?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Serial Port with a console cable

Selected Answer: B
Correct Answer: B. Serial console

A: Requires web interface (network needed).
B: Direct physical access, no network needed.
C: Telnet needs network connectivity.
D: SSH requires network connectivity.

Selected Answer: B
Serial Port with a console cable

Selected Answer: B
B is the correct answer.

Don't be fooled by 'CLI console widget'. To even get to the console widget you would need to access the web GUI, which would require a network connection to access it with the browser.
B IS CORRECT

Serial
Correct is B

Selected Answer: B
Serial console is correct.

Selected Answer: B
serial console

Selected Answer: B
B. Serial console

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit.

//IMG//


The exhibit shows a diagram of a FortiGate device connected to the network, the firewall policy and VIP configuration on the FortiGate device, and the routing table on the ISP router.

When the administrator tries to access the web server public address (203.0.113.2) from the internet, the connection times out. At the same time the administrator runs a sniffer on FortiGate to capture incoming web traffic to the server and does not see any output.

Based on the information shown in the exhibit, what configuration change must the administrator make to fix the connectivity issue?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
this happen only when you don't have an IP set in the FortiGate's interface directly, in this example, FortiGate can use the external IP because is connected throught ISP router port (it has no NAT from the ISP), so you need to enable ARP-Reply to let FortiGate answer requests with the WAN interface mac address

Selected Answer: B
The issue here is that the FortiGate device's VIP (Virtual IP) configuration has arp-reply disabled, which means that the FortiGate is not responding to ARP requests for the external IP address (203.0.113.2). As a result, devices trying to reach the public IP cannot resolve the MAC address of the FortiGate, leading to connectivity issues.

Selected Answer: B
FGT Admin guide page 65

Selected Answer: B
B. In the VIP configuration, enable arp-reply. Correct answer
B) In the VIP configuration, enable arp-reply.
B correct

choices.A: Configure a loopback interface with address 203.0.113.2/32.
choices.B: In the VIP configuration, enable arp-reply.
choices.C: In the firewall policy configuration, enable match-vip.
choices.D: Enable port forwarding on the server to map the external service port to the internal service port.

questions.question_text:
An organization requires remote users to send external application data running on their PCs and access FTP resources through an SSUTLS connection.

discussion.content:

There is a typo... SSL/TLS, not SSUTLS. But yes, B is correct, page 269.
